definitions.definition: A long, loud, deep shout, as of rage or laughter, made with the mouth wide open.
The deep cry of the bull.
A show of strength or character.
To make a loud, deep cry, especially from pain, anger, or other strong emotion.
To laugh in a particularly loud manner.
definitions.example: The audience roared at his jokes.

definitions.definition: Of animals (especially the lion), to make a loud deep noise.
definitions.example: The lioness roared to scare off the hyenas.

definitions.definition: Generally, of inanimate objects etc., to make a loud resounding noise.
To cry aloud; to proclaim loudly.
To be boisterous; to be disorderly.
To make a loud noise in breathing, as horses do when they have a certain disease.
